item.title: Grafitti is back, 27th January
item.description:
Your team removed extensive grafitti yesterday from my perimeter fence along the public footway. We were thrilled about your swift response. Regrettably more grafitti has appeared already, definitely done by the same person. Three fence panels have been sprayed a lot, with a bit more just around the corner from Ernest Close. I understand how frustrating this must be for you as well as us, but please would you revisit to remove it again. We are desperate to discourage this before it becomes the new normal to the young people who gather beside my garage at the corner of the lane. The only good news is that the garage has been left alone this time. And thank you so much for your last response, we really appreciated it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ernest Close, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole got worse..., 27th January
item.description:
The hole has grown significantly and vehicles are now scraping the front of their cars when driving over it. This is causing damage and is becoming a safety concern for drivers. I would appreciate it if this could be inspected and repaired as soon as possible to prevent further vehicle damage or potential accidents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lingfield Crescent, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on pavement, 27th January
item.description:
With heavy rain it always floods here. Hard for people to walk past to get to the park and is a pain when dropping off or picking up children at the school. There's no drainage and something needs to be put there for it to soak away to prevent the huge puddles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, Greater London
